mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Dr. Sidney Isenberg Collection on Carson McCullers Papers, 1948-1971
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: McCullers, Carson, 1917-1967
mdRecord.dcterms:description: McCullers is "disappointed in the reception of a story" she'd written. She mentions her ill health, her husband's non-alcoholic state, an upcoming meeting with Tennessee [Williams] and consequent need to finish her play, potential travel to Italy, and possible visits by Isenberg and Cleckley.

There are several files available. There is one JPG image for each page of the original document. One PDF was created from scans of the original document and includes all pages. One PDF is a transcription of the original document.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Health

Williams, Tennessee, 1911-1983
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter from Carson McCullers to Dr. Sidney Isenberg, August 11, 1948 (correspondence)
